channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Biden will name Kenya a major non-NATO ally during state visit
item.description: It’s been more than 15 years since an African leader was granted a White House state visit. President Biden is trying to upgrade the U.S. relationship with Kenya.
item.content:encoded:
It’s been more than 15 years since an African leader was granted a White House state visit. President Biden is trying to upgrade the U.S. relationship with Kenya.

(Image credit: MANDEL NGAN/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: A billionaire surprised graduates onstage with cash, but it's not all theirs to keep
item.description: Billionaire philanthropist Rob Hale gave UMass Dartmouth graduates $1,000 each, and instructed them to donate half. He tells NPR the best cause students can support is one that matters to them.
item.content:encoded:
Billionaire philanthropist Rob Hale gave UMass Dartmouth graduates $1,000 each, and instructed them to donate half. He tells NPR the best cause students can support is one that matters to them.

(Image credit: Karl Christoff Dominey)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: At least 4 people have died and 35 are injured in a tornado that swept through Iowa
item.description: Iowa's Department of Public Safety says there could be many more people injured. Other severe weather events, such as floods and snowstorms, are expected in other parts of the country.
item.content:encoded:
Iowa's Department of Public Safety says there could be many more people injured. Other severe weather events, such as floods and snowstorms, are expected in other parts of the country.

(Image credit: Charlie Neibergall)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Palestinian chef Fadi Kattan offers a tour of Bethlehem in his new cookbook
item.description: Bethlehem: A Celebration of Palestinian Food is a love letter to Kattan's boyhood home — and the scents and flavors that made it a special place to learn how to cook.
item.content:encoded:
Bethlehem: A Celebration of Palestinian Food is a love letter to Kattan's boyhood home — and the scents and flavors that made it a special place to learn how to cook.

(Image credit: Ashley Lima)
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: China launches military drills surrounding Taiwan
item.description: The drills are a warning to Taiwan's new president, who this week called on China in his inaugural address to cease its intimidation of Taiwan.
item.content:encoded:
The drills are a warning to Taiwan's new president, who this week called on China in his inaugural address to cease its intimidation of Taiwan.

(Image credit: YASUYOSHI CHIBA)
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: At least 9 people are dead after a stage collapsed at a political rally in Mexico
item.description: A strong gust of wind toppled the stage at a campaign rally Wednesday in the northern Mexican state of Nuevo Leon. In addition to the deaths, at least 60 people were injured.
item.content:encoded:
A strong gust of wind toppled the stage at a campaign rally Wednesday in the northern Mexican state of Nuevo Leon. In addition to the deaths, at least 60 people were injured.

(Image credit: Alberto Lopez)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: At long last, lead poisoning of kids is emerging as a priority on the world scene
item.description: It's been neglected for years, say global health advocates. Now it's getting more attention. And USAID has added it to its agenda with a $1.5 million budget line. Dr. Atul Gawande tells why.
item.content:encoded:
It's been neglected for years, say global health advocates. Now it's getting more attention. And USAID has added it to its agenda with a $1.5 million budget line. Dr. Atul Gawande tells why.

(Image credit: Tony Karumba)
item.dc:creator: Fran Kritz

item.title: Self-inflicted hit of pepper spray drives off an attacking grizzly in Grand Teton National Park
item.description: While mauling a hiker on Signal Mountain, the grizzly bit into the man's can of bear repellent and fled. The Massachusetts man, who'd pretended to be dead while he was being bitten, made it to safety.
item.content:encoded:
While mauling a hiker on Signal Mountain, the grizzly bit into the man's can of bear repellent and fled. The Massachusetts man, who'd pretended to be dead while he was being bitten, made it to safety.

(Image credit: Brennan Linsley)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: ADHD diagnoses are rising. 1 in 9 U.S. kids have gotten one, new study finds
item.description: ADHD is an ongoing and expanding public health concern, according to researchers studying the disorder. One million more U.S. children were diagnosed in 2022 compared to 2016, a new study shows.
item.content:encoded:
ADHD is an ongoing and expanding public health concern, according to researchers studying the disorder. One million more U.S. children were diagnosed in 2022 compared to 2016, a new study shows.

(Image credit: SIphotography)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Nikki Haley says she'll vote for Trump
item.description: The former South Carolina governor's remarks were her first on the matter since she dropped out of the presidential race. But she stopped short of formally endorsing her former rival.
item.content:encoded:
The former South Carolina governor's remarks were her first on the matter since she dropped out of the presidential race. But she stopped short of formally endorsing her former rival.

(Image credit: Emil Lippe)
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon
